channel.title: Papers with Code: Trending (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Fast Segment Anything
item.description: In this paper, we propose a speed-up alternative method for this fundamental task with comparable performance.

item.title: Full Parameter Fine-tuning for Large Language Models with Limited Resources
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have revolutionized Natural Language Processing (NLP) but demand massive GPU resources for training.

item.title: Planning-oriented Autonomous Driving
item.description: Oriented at this, we revisit the key components within perception and prediction, and prioritize the tasks such that all these tasks contribute to planning.

item.title: FinGPT: Open-Source Financial Large Language Models
item.description: While proprietary models like BloombergGPT have taken advantage of their unique data accumulation, such privileged access calls for an open-source alternative to democratize Internet-scale financial data.

item.title: A Simple and Effective Pruning Approach for Large Language Models
item.description: Motivated by the recent observation of emergent large magnitude features in LLMs, our approach prune weights with the smallest magnitudes multiplied by the corresponding input activations, on a per-output basis.

item.title: WizardCoder: Empowering Code Large Language Models with Evol-Instruct
item.description: Moreover, our model even outperforms the largest closed LLMs, Anthropic's Claude and Google's Bard, on HumanEval and HumanEval+.

item.title: WebGLM: Towards An Efficient Web-Enhanced Question Answering System with Human Preferences
item.description: We present WebGLM, a web-enhanced question-answering system based on the General Language Model (GLM).

item.title: On the Benefits of 3D Pose and Tracking for Human Action Recognition
item.description: Subsequently, we propose a Lagrangian Action Recognition model by fusing 3D pose and contextualized appearance over tracklets.

item.title: PyRCA: A Library for Metric-based Root Cause Analysis
item.description: We introduce PyRCA, an open-source Python machine learning library of Root Cause Analysis (RCA) for Artificial Intelligence for IT Operations (AIOps).

item.title: EasySpider: A No-Code Visual System for Crawling the Web
item.description: As such, web-crawling is an essential tool for both computational and non-computational scientists to conduct research.

item.title: TAP-Vid: A Benchmark for Tracking Any Point in a Video
item.description: Generic motion understanding from video involves not only tracking objects, but also perceiving how their surfaces deform and move.

item.title: LLaMA-Adapter V2: Parameter-Efficient Visual Instruction Model
item.description: This strategy effectively alleviates the interference between the two tasks of image-text alignment and instruction following and achieves strong multi-modal reasoning with only a small-scale image-text and instruction dataset.

item.title: BayLing: Bridging Cross-lingual Alignment and Instruction Following through Interactive Translation for Large Language Models
item.description: To minimize human workload, we propose to transfer the capabilities of language generation and instruction following from English to other languages through an interactive translation task.

item.title: Self-Supervised Learning from Images with a Joint-Embedding Predictive Architecture
item.description: This paper demonstrates an approach for learning highly semantic image representations without relying on hand-crafted data-augmentations.

item.title: ChemCrow: Augmenting large-language models with chemistry tools
item.description: Over the last decades, excellent computational chemistry tools have been developed.

item.title: WizMap: Scalable Interactive Visualization for Exploring Large Machine Learning Embeddings
item.description: Machine learning models often learn latent embedding representations that capture the domain semantics of their training data.

item.title: Fast Training of Diffusion Models with Masked Transformers
item.description: For masked training, we introduce an asymmetric encoder-decoder architecture consisting of a transformer encoder that operates only on unmasked patches and a lightweight transformer decoder on full patches.

item.title: Simple and Controllable Music Generation
item.description: We tackle the task of conditional music generation.

item.title: MAGVIT: Masked Generative Video Transformer
item.description: We introduce the MAsked Generative VIdeo Transformer, MAGVIT, to tackle various video synthesis tasks with a single model.

item.title: A Convolutional Neural Network for the Automatic Diagnosis of Collagen VI related Muscular Dystrophies
item.description: This decision scheme points to the possibly problematic areas in the input images and provides a global quantitative evaluation of the state of the patients, which is fundamental for diagnosis and to monitor the efficiency of therapies.
